screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .mhtml file in Google Chrome
screenshot.caption: MHTML file open in Google Chrome

description: MHTML stands for MIME encapsulation of aggregate HTML documents, or MIME HTML. The files are typically saved by a web browser from an .HTML file and are encoded with .MIME encoding.
MHTML files may be saved as .MHT files, although the .mhtml file extension is more commonly used. The .mhtml extension may also be renamed as .eml and opened as an .EML file instead of an MHTML file.
To create an MHTML web archive of a webpage in Chrome, follow these directions:
